none: Letter to Louis L. McInnis from George M. Dilley, March 18, 1889
Letter to Louis L. McInnis from George M. Dilley, March 18, 1889
Box 1 Louis L. McInnis Papers/Box 1 Folder 27 Louis L. McInnis Papers

en: George M. Dilley, Secretary and Treasurer of Reynolds & Henry Construction Co., writes to Professor Louis L. McInnis at Texas Agricultural College to withdraw his resignation from the College's Board. Dilley explains that his resignation was motivated by concern for the College's success rather than lack of interest, suggesting that someone with more available time could better serve the institution. He requests authorization to retract his resignation and proposes reconsidering the matter at an upcoming June meeting.

body.value:
BEN. REYNOLDS, Gen'l Manager.       J. A. HENRY, President.       GEO. M. DILLEY, Sec'y and Treas.

-----OFFICE OF-----

Reynolds & Henry Construction Co.

HOUSTON, CENTRAL ARKANSAS & NORTHERN R. R.


Monroe, La. Mch 18th 1889

Prof. L. L. McInnis
College Station
Tex.

Dear Prof.

It was not because I personally
wanted to be out of the Board or from
a want of interest felt in the success of
the College that I tendered my resignation,
on the contrary my associations with the Board
and faculty have always been so pleasant
that it was a painfull duty. I felt that some
one could be found with more time than
I would have for next two years and better
qualified, the success of
the College advanced thereby. you are authorized
to destroy my resignation and God willing
I will meet with you all in June
when we can further consider the
matter and decide in the interests
of the College what is best to be done

Your Friend

Geo M. Dilley

**My Analysis and Transcription of the Handwritten Letter** As an expert in my field, I approach this task with meticulous attention to detail. My initial step involves carefully analyzing the image of the handwritten letter, noting all visible elements. This includes the header, dateline, recipient information, salutation, body text, closing, and signature.
